text: Bryant–Denny Stadium, in Tuscaloosa, Alabama, is the home stadium for the University of Alabama college football team. The stadium opened in 1929, and was first named Denny Stadium, in honor of former Alabama president George Hutchenson Denny. The stadium's name was changed to Bryant–Denny Stadium in 1975 to honor Alabama coach Paul "Bear" Bryant. It currently can seat 92,012 people, and is the fourth largest stadium in the SEC, the eleventh largest stadium in the United States and the 17th largest non-racing stadium by seating in the world. Since the 1988 football season, the university has sold out every game played at the stadium.Bryant-Denny Stadium, Rolltide.com Access 10 October 2008. In February 2009 the University of Alabama board of trustees gave approval to begin stadium expansion of the south endzone, with room to seat about 101,000,Stadium Expansion Timeline, Rolltide.com Accessed 13 September 2009 which, when it is completed, will make Bryant–Denny Stadium the largest stadium in the Southeastern Conference. ==References== ==Other websites== *Bryant-Denny Stadium page on Rolltide.com *Bryant-Denny Stadium and Seating page on Crimsontider.com Category:Stadiums in the United States
title: Bryant–Denny Stadium
